body: Great, thanks!

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11550882/97578278-860f5600-1a2b-11eb-95be-9b5cbd3b29c3.png)
I reproduced the same problem as you. How did you solve it

## DCL Statements

@lwtdev I have checked the MySQL documentation again and found that the definition of the `SET PASSWORD` statement has changed in version 8.0, and version 5.7 supports PASSWORD systax.

```sql
SET PASSWORD [FOR user] = password_option

password_option: {
    'auth_string'
  | PASSWORD('auth_string')
}
```
I think we should support these two different versions of the syntax at the same time.

## DAL Satements

> Maybe we can support show create ? when we support create ? . I found that there are already some issues related to this.

Thank you very much for your suggestions. We will check similar syntax combinations later and support these SQLs as soon as possible.

> ShardingProxy(5.0.0.RC1)No Sharding
showKeysWithLike[hasShardingKey:none];	 Support:false;	SQL: SHOW KEYS in customer in db1 where column_name like '%id%';
java.sql.SQLException: 2Unknown exception: [Conversion = 'i']

This is caused by a sql parse error and will be fixed in this PR.

## RL Statements

> ShardingProxy(5.0.0.RC1)No Sharding
startSlaveIoThread[hasShardingKey:none];	 Support:false;	SQL: start slave io_thread until RELAY_LOG_FILE  = 'log_name', RELAY_LOG_POS = 4;
com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: This version of ShardingProxy doesn't yet support this SQL. 'Unsupported SQL of `start slave io_thread until RELAY_LOG_FILE  = 'log_name', RELAY_LOG_POS = 4`'

This SQL will be supported after PR is merged.


Thank you very much for the various test cases you have been providing. This is very important for the improvement of the SS 5.X version.
In order to facilitate the quick communication and resolution of follow-up questions, would you mind sending your WeChat account to my e-mailâ€”â€”strongduanmu@gmail.com? ðŸ˜€

Thanks for your kindly support.  
About try to use version 5.x, we do not find stable release version in centernal mvn repo, so we have some worry about using 5.x  online service.  
Now, we still use version 4.1.1 and switch connection pool to ali druid for work around.
not resolved

I also met this problem, my local test is good and have this problem in my test environment. 
And I used java8 lambda parallelStream(), I thought it might be a bug about multithreading.

Yes, I changed parallelStream() to stream(), it works fine.

> Thanks for your kindly support.
> About try to use version 5.x, we do not find stable release version in centernal mvn repo, so we have some worry about using 5.x online service.
> Now, we still use version 4.1.1 and switch connection pool to ali druid for work around.

that sound well.
and can you try hikari for your case?

sharding-proxy/jdbc get values from sql, and there is only string in sql statement.
For example, " select * from order where created_time>'2020-10-30' ", and sharding key's value will be 2020-10-30.

Only in orm(mybatis), it hold the object with an accurate type. but sql is just a string.

@strongduanmu I have run test case use newest version(2020/10/30 15 master)ã€‚ All test cases intended to be supported are tested okã€‚Test results as fallow:

- **Results Summary**

|SQL Demo Title |SQL Demo |Sharding Column |ShardingProxy(4.1.1)No Sharding |ShardingProxy(5.0.0.RC1)No Sharding |
|---- |---- |---- |---- |---- |
|truncate |TRUNCATE customer; |NONE |Y |Y |
|truncateTable |TRUNCATE TABLE customer; |NONE |Y |Y |
|createIndex |CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_customer_email using btree on customer_email  (email(10)) comment 'index for email'; |NONE |Y |Y |
|dropIndex |DROP INDEX idx_customer_email on customer_email; |NONE |Y |Y |
|dropIndexWithAlgorithm |DROP INDEX idx_customer_email on customer_email algorithm = default; |NONE |Y |Y |
|dropIndexPrimary |DROP INDEX \`PRIMARY\` ON customer_email; |NONE |Y |Y |
|grant |GRANT SELECT ON db2.customer TO 'jeffrey'@'localhost'; |NONE |Y |Y |
|setPassword |SET PASSWORD FOR 'bob'@'%.example.org' = 'auth_string'; |NONE |Y |Y |
|setPasswordWithPasswordFunction |SET PASSWORD FOR 'bob'@'%.example.org' = PASSWORD('auth_string'); |NONE |Y |Y |
|setCharacterSet |SET Character Set 'utf8'; |NONE |Y |Y |
|showCreateEvent |SHOW CREATE EVENT event_name; |NONE |Y |N |
|showCreateUser |SHOW CREATE USER \`user\`; |NONE |Y |N |
|showCreateView |SHOW CREATE VIEW view_name; |NONE |Y |N |
|showIndexWithDb |SHOW INDEXES from customer in db1; |NONE |Y |Y |
|showKeysWithLike |SHOW KEYS in customer in db1 where column_name like '%id%'; |NONE |Y |Y |
|startSlaveSqlThread |start slave sql_thread until MASTER_LOG_FILE = 'log_name', MASTER_LOG_POS = 4; |NONE |Y |Y |
|startSlaveIoThread |start slave io_thread until RELAY_LOG_FILE  = 'log_name', RELAY_LOG_POS = 4; |NONE |Y |Y |
|stopSlave |stop slave io_thread for channel 'channel1'; |NONE |Y |Y |
|stopGroupReplication |STOP GROUP_REPLICATION; |NONE |Y |N |

- **Unsupported SQL Details**

```sql
ShardingProxy(4.1.1)No Sharding
showCreateEvent[hasShardingKey:none];	 Support:true;	SQL: SHOW CREATE EVENT event_name;
ds_0|SHOW CREATE EVENT event_name|

ShardingProxy(5.0.0.RC1)No Sharding
showCreateEvent[hasShardingKey:none];	 Support:false;	SQL: SHOW CREATE EVENT event_name;
java.sql.SQLException: 2Unknown exception: [null]

ShardingProxy(4.1.1)No Sharding
showCreateUser[hasShardingKey:none];	 Support:true;	SQL: SHOW CREATE USER `user`;
ds_0|SHOW CREATE USER `user`|

ShardingProxy(5.0.0.RC1)No Sharding
showCreateUser[hasShardingKey:none];	 Support:false;	SQL: SHOW CREATE USER `user`;
java.sql.SQLException: 2Unknown exception: [null]

ShardingProxy(4.1.1)No Sharding
showCreateView[hasShardingKey:none];	 Support:true;	SQL: SHOW CREATE VIEW view_name;
ds_0|SHOW CREATE VIEW view_name|

ShardingProxy(5.0.0.RC1)No Sharding
showCreateView[hasShardingKey:none];	 Support:false;	SQL: SHOW CREATE VIEW view_name;
java.sql.SQLException: 2Unknown exception: [null]

ShardingProxy(4.1.1)No Sharding
stopGroupReplication[hasShardingKey:none];	 Support:true;	SQL: STOP GROUP_REPLICATION;
ds_0|STOP GROUP_REPLICATION|

ShardingProxy(5.0.0.RC1)No Sharding
stopGroupReplication[hasShardingKey:none];	 Support:false;	SQL: STOP GROUP_REPLICATION;
java.sql.SQLException: 2Unknown exception: [null]
```
According to logs, something with seata is wrong.

> I also met this problem, my local test is good and have this problem in my test environment.

But this post show an error maybe from mybatis-plus or seata.
Can you show your config files?

@strongduanmu I have run all test case use newest version(2020/10/30 15 master), and found some other problems. you may have a look at this issue:

> When the table is not sharding , in 5.0.0, SQL parsing is wrong, but it is correct before #7978

@shihuizhen 

1. Statement.RETURN_GENERATED_KEYS and using Key-generator in 4.x  works well, but without key-gen doesn't.
you can wait for 5.0.0 version,  this week release.

2. @@identity or last_insert_id has no plan to support now.
you can try to fix it.

SQL for testing

```
-- @title:deleteMultiTable,hasShardingKey:none
delete customer, customer_email from customer , customer_email where customer.status = 3;

-- @title:selectIntoVarAfterFrom,hasShardingKey:none
select * from customer into @myvar;
```

Thanks a lot @lwtdev .
These cases are marked as UNSupported in docs.

There is no plan for these case.
Can you make a pr for it?
As we can't reproduce this case and for several days, close this issue now.

any update or more details, guys?
Pls reference sharding rule documents.

When using ShardingProxy to operate mysql  in the project,
there is no problem about add, delete or update
But the query does not return data

```
spring:
  shardingsphere:
    sharding:
      tables:
        topic:
          actual-data-nodes: live-content.topic_$->{0..1}
          table-strategy:
            inline:
              sharding-column: user_id
              algorithm-expression: topic_$->{user_id % 2}
        comment:
          actual-data-nodes: live-content.comment_$->{0..7}
          table-strategy:
            inline:
              sharding-column: topic_id
              algorithm-expression: comment_$->{topic_id % 8}
        game:
          actual-data-nodes: live-content.game
        game_ext:
          actual-data-nodes: live-content.game_ext
        live:
          actual-data-nodes: live-content.live
        slideshow:
          actual-data-nodes: live-content.slideshow
        star:
          actual-data-nodes: live-content.star
        tag:
          actual-data-nodes: live-content.tag
        team:
          actual-data-nodes: live-content.team
ci has not passed.
It will route to all table without sharding key in query sql.

@kimmking In fact, these sql also works well in 4.11

```
ShardingProxy(4.1.1)No Sharding
deleteMultiTable[hasShardingKey:none];	 Support:true;	SQL: delete customer, customer_email from customer , customer_email where customer.status = 3;
ds_0|delete customer, customer_email from customer , customer_email where customer.status = 3|

ShardingProxy(4.1.1)No Sharding
selectIntoVarAfterFrom[hasShardingKey:all];	 Support:true;	SQL: select * from customer where id = 3 into @myvar;
ds_0|select * from customer where id = 3 into @myvar|
```
> There is no plan for these case.
Can you make a pr for it?

Maybe we can fix it at beta version ~
An optimization method is to search attach the route key, such as user_id above

> @strongduanmu thank you. I had to override the paging plug-in for Mybatis-Plus to fix this problem

Can you provide the overridden class? What does the count() SQL look like?

> Can you show your config 
hi,@kimmking 

>>**_It's working fine in sqlserver and mariadb, but oracle._**
oracle version:  11.2.0.1.0 - Production
mariadb version: 10.5.5-MariaDB
sqlserver vesion: Microsoft SQL Server 2017 (RTM) - 14.0.1000.169 (X64)
sharding-jdbc-spring-boot-starter version: 4.1.1
```log
server:
  port: 8080

demo:
  driver-class-name: oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver
  jdbc-url: jdbc:oracle:thin:@ip:1521:helowin
  username: 
  password:

#  password:

#  jdbc-url: jdbc:mysql://ip:3306/spring?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf-8&serverTimezone=UTC
#  username: 
#  password: 


spring:
  profiles:
    active: sharding-tables
  application:
    name: demo-service
  jpa:
    hibernate:
      ddl-auto: update
      naming:
        physicalStrategy: org.hibernate.boot.model.naming.PhysicalNamingStrategyStandardImpl
    show-sql: true
  shardingsphere:
    datasource:
      names: db0
      db0:
      type: com.zaxxer.hikari.HikariDataSource
      driver-class-name: ${demo.driver-class-name}
      jdbc-url: ${demo.jdbc-url}
      username: ${demo.username}
      password: ${demo.password}
    sharding:
      tables:
      apple:
        actualDataNodes: db0.APPLE_20$->{20..21}_0$->{1..9},db0.APPLE_20$->{20..21}_$->{10..12}
        keyGenerator:
        column: id
        type: SNOWFLAKE
        default-table-strategy:
      complex:
        sharding-columns: id
        algorithm-class-name: com.demo.support.DemoTableShardingAlgorithm
    props:
      sql.show: true

mybatis-plus:
  mapper-locations: classpath:/mapper/*Mapper.xml
  configuration:
    cache-enabled: false
    log-impl: org.apache.ibatis.logging.stdout.StdOutImpl

```

> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/shardingsphere/pull/7996?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [942d2d3...4587fc6](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/shardingsphere/pull/7996?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

Generally, I prefer (2) if there is no performance difference between (1) and (2) for the following reasons.
1. Instance methods are more friendly to extend, such as hierarchy override.
1. From my personal preference, the static method doesn't bring a better user experience in this case.

But, at the same time, I want to point out, 
1. There is a duplicated `dbType` parameter for the `visitor`, no matter either way. As the parsing result, you definitely have known the type, this second `dbType` could be skipped and auto-injection through the ASTTree.
1. `useCache` seems like a configuration? Do you plan to use a general configuration(even map/properties) to prepare for the extension in the future?
1. `visitorType` is really necessary? Is there another chance to get different results? Because Java doesn't recommend/support the different types of the return value, it is hard to see how to implement the new type. Could you share some ideas about this parameter?

> Generally, I prefer (2) if there is no performance difference between (1) and (2) for the following reasons.
> 
> 1. Instance methods are more friendly to extend, such as hierarchy override.
> 2. From my personal preference, the static method doesn't bring a better user experience in this case.
> 
> But, at the same time, I want to point out,
> 
> 1. There is a duplicated `dbType` parameter for the `visitor`, no matter either way. As the parsing result, you definitely have known the type, this second `dbType` could be skipped and auto-injection through the ASTTree.

Because of original SQL do not carry db information, so the AST cannot know the database type. 

> 2. `useCache` seems like a configuration? Do you plan to use a general configuration(even map/properties) to prepare for the extension in the future?

`useCache` is not for configuration only, it is better to use cache if SQL with parameter markers (SELECT * FROM xxx WHERE id=?), and it is unnecessary if user use raw SQL (SELECT * FROM xxx WHERE id=1)

> 3. `visitorType` is really necessary? Is there another chance to get different results? Because Java doesn't recommend/support the different types of the return value, it is hard to see how to implement the new type. Could you share some ideas about this parameter?

`STATEMENT` is one of  `visitorType` for convert AST to SQL statement object, another `visitorType` is `FORMAT` which can support SQL formatted feature.
We may add some new visitor types in future, such as `AUDIT` which for audit whether SQL can run or not on related rule or performance issue.
The return type is use generic type <T> for now which is returned from SQL visitor generic return type.

> Because of original SQL do not carry db information, so the AST cannot know the database type.

But the ParseTree knows as it is already a parameter of `SQLParserEngine`

> useCache is not for configuration only, it is better to use cache if SQL with parameter markers (SELECT * FROM xxx WHERE id=?), and it is unnecessary if user use raw SQL (SELECT * FROM xxx WHERE id=1)

I know the background, I was just asking about the API design, not function.

> STATEMENT is one of visitorType for convert AST to SQL statement object, another visitorType is FORMAT which can support SQL formatted feature.
We may add some new visitor types in future, such as AUDIT which for audit whether SQL can run or not on related rule or performance issue.
The return type is use generic type for now which is returned from SQL visitor generic return type.

Same as above, I am not arguing for the functional correct. I am just saying if this API is designed for the extension, then, giving a parameter is not enough, because you can't give another parameter and add a new return type, Java doesn't support that.
@Lucas-307 These images prove that proxy returns are incorrectï¼ŒI'm going to give you an example to reproduce it

@tristaZero , I prefer the second way, because the second way is more suitable to expand according to the SQL dialect. IMO, when calling `parse()` method, the Parser should be binded with SQL dialect and known with the database type. And the interfaces of`SQLParserEngine` and `SQLVisitorEngine` in the first way isn't conducive to expansion and calling `parse()` and `visit()` method with `dbType` and  `visitorType ` makes no sense. And other parameters like `useCache ` should use config instead of single parameter.

@terrymanu IMO, the second way is better because from the interface level, the second way is more elegant and the code structure is more intuitive. In the first way, merging all visitors' logic into same one, the code is very unintuitive and its readability is also very bad.
@XiaoleLee , `rangeAlgorithmClassName` should be used with `preciseAlgorithmClassName`. You could add this config to yaml config.
@maxlange , could you provide exception stack information?
@tuohai666 , about this issue, do you recently have any pull request to fix the problem above mentioned?

I prefer the second way also.
but duplicated dbType  is a little strange to use.
